member.name: T:Outpost31.Core.Avatar.AvatarEnvironment
member.remarks:
An Avatar environment consists of two components: the Avatar System and Avatar System Code.
While both contain the word system, they are not the same! It is important to understand the difference between the two.
For more information about Outpost31, please see the file.

member.name: P:Outpost31.Core.Avatar.AvatarEnvironment.AvatarSystem
member.summary: The Avatar System that the Tingen Web Service will interface with.

remarks.note:
Modify the AvtrSys setting
Open the Web.Config file located in the root directory of the Tingen Web Service.
Locate the AvtrSys setting within the applicationSettings section.
Change the value of the AvtrSys setting to the desired value.
Save the changes to the Web.Config file.
For example, to set the Avatar System to `LIVE`:
<setting name="AvtrSys" serializeAs="String"> <value>LIVE</value> </setting>
Changes to the AvtrSys setting will be applied the next time the Tingen Web Service is executed.

member.name: P:Outpost31.Core.Avatar.AvatarEnvironment.AvatarSystemCode
member.summary: The Avatar System Code used to login to Avatar.

member.name: T:Outpost31.Core.Avatar.AvatarOptionObject
member.summary: The AvatarOptionObject contains metadata about the Avatar environment.
member.remarks: For more information about Outpost31, please see the file.

member.name: P:Outpost31.Core.Avatar.AvatarOptionObject.Original
member.summary: The original OptionObject sent from Avatar.
member.remarks: This OptionObject is never modified during a Tingen Web Service session.

member.name: P:Outpost31.Core.Avatar.AvatarOptionObject.Worker
member.summary: The OptionObject where work is done.
member.remarks: This OptionObject is potentially modified during a Tingen Web Service session.

member.name: P:Outpost31.Core.Avatar.AvatarOptionObject.Completed
member.summary: The finalized OptionObject that is returned to Avatar.
member.remarks: This is the finalized OptionObject, ready to be returned to Avatar.

member.name: M:Outpost31.Core.Avatar.AvatarOptionObject.VerifyExistence(ScriptLinkStandard.Objects.OptionObject2015)
member.summary: Verify if an OptionObject was sent from Avatar.
member.param: The original OptionObject sent from Avatar.
member.returns: A string indicating if an OptionObject was sent or not.

member.name: M:Outpost31.Core.Avatar.AvatarScriptParameter.VerifyExistence(System.String)
member.summary: Verify if a Script Parameter was sent from Avatar.
member.param: The original Script Parameter sent from Avatar.
member.returns: A string indicating if an Script Parameter was sent or not.

member.name: M:Outpost31.Core.Logger.LogEvent.Critical(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Int32,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Int32)
member.remarks: This is public because TngnWsvc may need to call it.

member.name: M:Outpost31.Core.Logger.LogEvent.Primeval(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Primeval logs are used when the advanced logging infrastructure isn't available.

remarks.para:
Primeval logs can be utilized prior to building the logging infrastructure.
Since primeval logs may be written very quickly, there is a 1000ms delay
before committing data.This can potentially cause performance issues.
Syntax: LogEvent.Primeval(avtrSys, "Optional message.");

member.param: The log message, which defaults to "Primeval log." if not specified.

member.name: M:Outpost31.Core.Logger.LogEvent.GetClassName(System.String)
member.summary: Get the class name from the full class path.
